(beat) But I'm sure you already knew that. (beat) That's what turns me on about you. HeyВ… maybe I'll give you a call sometime, lieutenant. Your number still 911? Alrighty then! Ace exits.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Roger Podacter went out after work. He had a few drinks, and he came home. But he wasn't alone.  Someone was with him in this apartment. There was a struggle, and then Roger Podacter was thrown over that balcony. Roger Podacter didn't commit suicide. He was murdered. A beat as everyone considers this.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Well, that's a very entertaining story, but real detectives have to worry about that little thing lawyers call evidence. Ace picks up a lottery ticket on Podacter's desk and beco

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Let's take a trip to clue corner, shall we? Can anyone tell me why a man buys a lottery ticket on the day he is going to commit suicide? Or why the family pet, suffering from acute canine trauma, clawed at the bedroom door until his paws bled? How about the blood on the railing? I'll bet if we put our thinking caps on we'll see that it was the result of the struggle that took place inside this apartment while Mr. Podacter was still alive! (singing)

dialogues.speaker: COME ON BACK TO CLUE CORNER

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Not a bad try for a pet detective, but not near conclusive enough for us real investigators. (beat) First, people buy lottery tickets everyday. It's a habit. It doesn't prove a thing. Second, the dog wasn't suffering from canine trauma, he was suffering from bladder trauma. Sergeant Neilson found a piss stain as big as Lake Huron near the bed. And third, the blood on the railing. Simple. He doesn't jump far enough and whacks his head. A fact confirmed by the paramedics who found cuts on his scalp, with traces of a white chalky substance. i.e. plaster from the balcony. Einhorn shows Ace the paramedics report. Everyone is impr

I have exorcised the demons! (a la Poltergeist) This house is clear.

dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: I'm thinking this whole thing is connected somehow. (frustrated) I'm thinking I want to find that other ring!

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: You checked all the rings.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: I know, Pessimistress. Could anyone else have gotten a ring that year?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: No. Camp was the only honoree. Just players and coaches. Everyone in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: В…Receipts! There must be receipts! You have a key to the office.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Ace this has been a really tough day. Can't we do this in the morning? Ace looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace's car screeches to a stop, in front of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. Team pictures adorn the walls.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: These files go back to seventy- eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace is flipping through a file cabinet, looking at receip

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: That was pretty impressive, what you did back at the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (still looking) You don't have to tell me. I was there.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have joined the police forceВ… become a real detective.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I don't do humans. Melissa gets a bit closer.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: You really love animals, don't you? Ace stops searching and looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: I feel a kinship with them. I understand them. Wanna hear something kinda spooky?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Sure. She gets closer still.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: One time, when I was about twelve, I had this dream that I was being followed by a dog with rabies. He had these really bloodshot eyes and foam coming out of his mouthВ… and just before I got to my front doorВ… he jumped on me and sunk his teeth in. Then I woke up, and felt the back of my neckВ… check this out. Ace motions for Melissa to feel the back of his neck, but barking like a vicious dog.

dialogues.speaker: ARARAR
dialogues.text: Melissa jumps out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Ohhh!! You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (snickering) I'm sorry. I couldn't stop myself. Are these all the receipts?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: (mildly annoyed) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: There's only a dozen of them here. Ace turns from the file cabinet with a hopeless look on h mess.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: (pointedly) GeeВ… maybe they were misplaced because somebody didn't put the files back when he wasВ…

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: WhatВ… Ace crosses to a big picture of the '82 team that hangs o player.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: That! Who the hell is that?! He quickly pulls out his crossed out pictures of the team

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Oh, that's Ray FinkleВ… the kicker. Don't you know who Ray Finkle is?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: No! How come he's not in this picture?! Melissa checks Ace's photo.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: This was the picture you were using? This was taken earlier in the year. Finkle wasn't added to the roster till mid-season. She starts to realize what Ace has already figured out.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's the guy that missed the final field goal in the Super Bowl that year. Cost the Dolphins the game.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: But he got a ring?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace and Melissa look through Finkle's file on a microfich flash before themВ…

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: 'Replacement Kicker Having Great Year'В… 'Ready For Super Bowl, Confident Kicker Boasts'.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: 'Field Goal Sails Wide, Dolphins Lose Super Bowl'.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: The kick heard round the world. That was Finkle. The Dolphins lost by one point. Another headline hits the screen: FINKLE CONTRACT NOT REN

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Poor guy.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Poor guy with a motive, baby. Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Last I heard, he went back to his home town, Collier County. He used to work in a bar up there.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (pondering) REHEHEALLY.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Can you drop me off before you go?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No way. It may not be safe at your apartment, and you shouldn't be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: What do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a person's butt under a sheet coming up into frame SKIN, SWEAT, SHEETS FLY,  as Ace and Melissa roll back an no prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 50 animals at the bottom of the bed, with eyes as big as cut back and forth between furious lovemaking and shots o Melissa and Ace simultaneously reach the pinnacle of plea

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: (totally amazed and exausted) OH manВ… oh man! Oh wow!

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (mock embarrassment) I'm sorryВ… that's never happened to me before. I must be tired.

dialogues.text: I wouldn't know anything about that, but if you could point me toward the bar. Fern breaks down, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: WellВ… Hypothetically speaking, say they all left you and went to the Pigskin Sports Bar. How would they have gotten there from here?

dialogues.text: If depression had a home, this is it. Several dejected me around the bar. A couple hapless guys play pool. One thro Ace enters, pops a sunflower seed in his mouth and addres

dialogues.text: What a diiick! They all move closer in a threatening manner.

dialogues.speaker: ACE

dialogues.speaker: HICK
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I gotta take a wicked Finkle. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTHLESS GIANT
dialogues.text: What's the difference between Finkle and a jackass? A jackass can kick. More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (facetious) WaitВ…  I know this one.

dialogues.speaker: HICK

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: It's good you're dealing with the anger. (beat) I don't suppose anyone's seen him lately? The chanting stops and the guys all look at Ace.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: NoВ… but we know where his parents live! Don't we boys?!

dialogues.speaker: HICK
dialogues.text: Yeah! We sure do! They all laugh insanely again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace pulls up outside a two-story stilt house. The place h bullet holes and paint bombs. Toilet paper is strewn thro on the door. A wooden peephole slides open revealing a su

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: В…Hi, I'm looking for Ray Finkle. A gun slides out into Ace's face.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (with a gulp) And a clean pair of shorts. A deep gruff voice from inside.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: What do you know about Ray Finkle?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Southpaw soccer style kicker. Graduated from Collier High in June, 1976. Stetson University honors graduate, class of 1980. Holds two NCAA division one records. One for most points in a season, one for distance. Former nickname The Mule. The first and only pro athlete ever to come out of Collier County. And one helluva model American. After a beat the peephole closes. The door slowly creaks unsmiling, taciturn, elderly man holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Are you another one of them scumbags from 'Hard Copy'?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: No, sir. I'm just a very big Finkle fan. This is my Graceland, sir. Mrs. Finkle, a sweet, adorable elderly woman comes over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Will you put that gun down. The boy's a fan of our son. So nice to meet you. I'm Ray's mother, and this is Ray's father.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: It's a real honor.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: My Ray is so appreciative of his fans. He'll be so pleased you stopped by.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Are you expecting Ray anytime soon?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. I expect him home any minute. Ace is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Would you like some cookies? I just baked them. Mrs. Finkle hurries off to the kitchen. Ace smiles at Mr.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: WowВ… Ray Finkle's house! Can't wait to meet him!

dialogues.speaker: MR. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Ray ain't comin' home.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: But your wife said you expect him home any minute.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FINKLE
dialogues.text: She expects him home any minute. He points to his head, and looks toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Engines runnin but there's no one behind the wheel. Ten years ago our son escaped from Shady Acres Psychiatric Hospital in Tampa. They're still buggin' us to pick up his stuff. Mrs. Finkle returns with a plate of football shaped cooki

dialogues.text: (sweetly) It was all that Dan Marino's fault, everyone knows that. If he had held the ball laces out, like you're supposed to, Ray would never have missed that kick. Dan Marino should die of Gonorrhea and rot in Hell. Would you like a cookie, son? Ace takes a cookie. Holding it up.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Hey, what do ya know. They're little footballs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Laces OUT! CRASH!! A large stone smashes through the window. Outside patrons from the Pigskin Sports Bar drives by yelling the

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: I told you he had a lot of fans. Mrs. Finkle picks up the rock and hurls it out the broken knocking him out cold, as the truck peels away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FINKLE
dialogues.text: (aside to Ace) She got the arm. The boy got the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Finkle and Ace are walking down the hallway to Ray's

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: When Ray gets back and starts kicking again, he'll never even know he was gone. I kept his room just the way he left it. She opens the door to Ray's room. Ace steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a death shrine to Dan Marino. Complete with lifesize nooses around the neck, other hacked to pieces. Painted o Marino must die!!!, etc.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: В…Oooh boy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: What a sports nut, huh? In the center of the room is a movie projector.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FINKLE
dialogues.text: Oh yes. By all means. Mrs. Finkle shuts the lights off. Ace turns on the projec The film flickers over the "Marino must die!!!" graffiti. Marino takes the snap, Finkle kicks and the ball sails wi

dialogues.text: Ace runs a red light causing cars to skid in every direct

dialogues.text: Ace's car smashes through benches and tables. Then it fli wheels with a horrid SMASH. Ace is still strapped into th Ace's prized WHITE PIGEON lands on the car door right bes sees the bird. Then, with a sudden quick lunge he success about Marino.

There ar perched on the telephone wires around the park and on the The sky grows darker. He slowly turns and tries to get ba Ace sets the white pigeon free and starts to run, but it' and gouging, and ripping his flesh. Now we see ten birds flying away with a leg. dialogues.text: Ace is back in his wrecked car with his arm hanging out t

dialogues.text: Hey mister. Hey mister. Ace come to suddenly, and looks at the boy with a crazed

dialogues.text: That was a really neat crash, mister. Do it again! Ace sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOBE HEADLINE
dialogues.text: Marino stands with several Space Aliens in football gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chaotic press conference. Zillions of REPORTERS shout a

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, have there been any ransom demands?

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: There's been no communication with the kidnappers at this time.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to the Super Bowl? Will it be postponed?

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: As of now, the game is going on as scheduled.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Why wasn't the public told about Snowflake's kidnapping?

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Secrecy was essential. We didn't want any public interference.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Are the crimes related? And what about Roger Podacter's murder?

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't comment any further. Now if you'll excuse me. Einhorn pushes her way through the crowd of reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einhorn is barking out orders to other cops as she heads

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Emilio, get me the autopsy on Podacter! Aguado, send out a memo. No one talks to the pressВ…

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: В…And somebody get me a cup of coffee!

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (TV announcer's voice) Tonight on "MIAMI VICE", Crockett geets the boss coffee! Ace is in her office, popping sunflower seeds, kicking ba bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Ventura, when I get out of this bathroom, you better be gone.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Is it number one or number two? Einhorn turns and glares at Ace.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: I just want to know how much time I have. Einhorn goes to the sink and begins washing her hands.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, I went ahead and solved that pesky, Snowflake/Podacter/Marino thing.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: yeah, ever hear of a former Dolphin kicker named Ray Finkle? The water shuts off. Einhorn appears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Alright, Ventura. Make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: I found a rare stone at the bottom of Snowflake's tank. It's from a Dolphin '82 AFC Championship ring. It would have been a Super Bowl ring, but Ray Finkle missed the big kick. Blames the whole thing on Marino. We're talking paranoid, delusional psychosis. I saw the guy's roomВ… Cozy, if you're Hannibal Lector.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: So how does Roger Podacter fit in?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: My guess is Finkle was snooping around. Podacter recognized him. End of story. As for SnowflakeВ… they gave him Finkle's number, and taught him how to kick a field goal. Finkle took it personally. Einhorn listens with great interest.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: So where is Finkle, now?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: He broke out of a metal hospital. Did a Claude Raines. He's been planning his revenge for years. Waiting for the perfect time to get back at the Dolphins. The time when it would hurt them the most. Super Bowl time! Man, I'm tired of being right! Einhorn walks in front and sits on the edge of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You've done some fine detective work, Ace.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Ahh, could you talk in my good ear. I thought I heard you call me Ace. Einhorn gets real close.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Maybe I was wrong about you. Maybe you are more than just a pet dick.

dialogues.speaker: SHE SUDDENLY PLANTS A MAJOR, TONSIL CLEANING, OPEN MOUTHE
dialogues.text: ACE. Objects are knocked off the desk as they lean back.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Your gun's digging into my hip. More kissing, the Ace stops.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: (still coming on) What's wrong, Ace? Want me to read you your rights?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: What is it? That bony little bitch, Melissa Robinson?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (defensive) No. You just don't do anything for me. He quickly adjusts his crotch, to conceal the erection. E

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: I'll be here if you ever want a real woman. There's a sharp KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: What is it? Aguado opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: AGUADO
dialogues.text: Everything okay in here?  Heard some commotion.

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Fine, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: AGUADO
dialogues.text: You want me to throw him out?

dialogues.speaker: EINHORN
dialogues.text: Why don't you throw yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: AGUADO
dialogues.text: В…Yes, ma'am. A crestfallen Aguado exits. Ace heads for the door.
